title: Ashok Leyland unveils GARUD 15M: India's first front engine multi-axle bus chassis
content: Ashok Leyland, the flagship of the Hinduja Group, has introduced India’s first front engine multi-axle bus chassis, GARUD 15M, at Prawaas 4.0. Designed for long-distance travel, it features 42 sleeper berths, the highest GVW in its category, and advanced comfort and safety features. Commercial launch is set for Q4 FY25.

title: Varroc appoints Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as Head of R&D for Business II
content: Varroc has appointed Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as the Head of R&D for Business II. Dr. Glander, based in Germany, will oversee the development of advanced automotive technologies such as ADAS and DMS. His role aims to strengthen Varroc's innovation and competitive edge. He brings 20 years of experience in the automotive sector.

title: Questions about the safety of Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system are growing
content: Tesla's "Full Self-Driving" system is under scrutiny following incidents where the technology performed unsafe maneuvers. Analyst William Stein's tests found the system lacking, and a fatal crash in Seattle has raised further concerns. Federal regulators are investigating the safety of Tesla's automated driving systems.

title: Ather Energy collaborates with Google to provide real-time EV charging station information
content: Ather Energy has partnered with Google to provide real-time information on fast-charging stations for electric two-wheelers in India. Users can now find Ather Grid chargers on Google Maps with live status updates, improving the convenience of charging and promoting wider adoption of electric vehicles in the country.

title: Encouraging only a single tech not the right strategy for India: Maruti Suzuki Chairman R C Bhargava
content: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava, at the company's 43rd annual general meeting, emphasised the need for various fuel technologies to meet India's Net Carbon Zero Emission target. Maruti Suzuki is focusing on hybrids, CNG, biogas, and hydrogen fuel while planning to launch its first EV model soon and significantly expand exports by 2030.

title: AI crucial for future, India should lead global tech transition, create jobs: Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal
content: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal stressed the private sector's role in job creation, stating businesses must step up while the government creates an enabling environment. title: Automakers’ tech alliances threaten IT’s ER&D bastion
content: Advanced Driver Assistance System (ADAS), Electric Vehicles (EVs) and Software Defined Vehicles (SDVs) are main drivers of tech spend for automakers globally, experts said to ET. An increase in the focus on high-end infotainment inside vehicles is also making software inputs for vehicles grow in recent years. As per analysts at Kotak Institutional Equities, Volkswagen and Xpeng will be jointly developing zonal E/E (electrical / electronic) architecture to turn pure electric models of Volkswagen brands into software-defined vehicles in China from 2026.

title: Auto Inc seeks policy boost for faster transition to green vehicles
content: India's adoption of electric and hybrid vehicles was significantly lower than China's, with EV penetration at 2.5% compared to China's 49%. Experts recommended incentivizing plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) to address economic and infrastructural barriers. Major automakers supported this strategy as a vital step towards promoting cleaner mobility solutions.

title: Strong hybrids rev up to fly past EVs in green race as car sales make a pit stop
content: Strong hybrid vehicle sales grew 62.5% in the June quarter, driven by the Uttar Pradesh government's incentives. In contrast, electric vehicle sales have stalled due to range anxiety and costs. Manufacturers are now exploring alternative technologies, such as hybrids and flex-fuel, to bridge the gap. The Indian EV infra remains a work in progress.

The Indian EV infra remains a work in progress.

title: US auto safety regulator closes probe into GM's Cruise robotaxis
content: The NHTSA said the Office of Defects Investigation has determined that Cruise vehicles were involved in 10 crashes and four of them resulted in injury of vulnerable road users, after analyzing hard braking data from 7,632 incidents commanded by Cruise's automated driving system.

title: EV battery-testing centre in B’luru soon
content: The facility, for which Union consumer affairs minister Pralhad Joshi laid foundation stone on Thursday, will come up on one acre at the National Test House (NTH), on the Regional Reference Standard Laboratory campus in Jakkur. This cutting-edge testing facility will help South Indian EV manufacturers, especially with regard to ascertaining battery efficiency, safety standards, and meeting performance metrics.
